intro: Bunburya capensis, commonly known as the Cape bunburya, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub with linear, aromatic leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is well adapted to arid and coastal environments, often found in sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value and resilience, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in regions with a Mediterranean climate.
